1.brief: a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a virgin (from her privacy); sometimes (by continuation) a bride; also (figuratively) a city or state

2.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
properly, smoothness (of the tongue); also an allotment
properly, the upper part, used only adverbially with prefix upward, above, overhead, from the top, etc.
properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion
altitude, i.e. concretely (an elevated place), abstractly (elevation, figuratively (elation), or adverbially (aloft)

3.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol

4.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate

5.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
evil (as destructive), literally (ruin) or morally (especially guile); figuratively idolatry (as false, subjective), uselessness (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in vain)
to hurry; figuratively, to be eager with excitement or enjoyment
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda

6.brief: to suspend or poise (especially in trade)
(only in the dual) a pair of scales
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

7.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
properly, to impinge, i.e. cling or adhere; figuratively, to catch by pursuit
to stain; a blemish (physically or morally)

8.brief: to sow; figuratively, to disseminate, plant, fructify
properly, hinder; generally, next, other, etc.
to root, i.e. strike into the soil, or (by implication) to pluck from it

to open, i.e. be (causatively, make) roomy; usually figuratively (in a mental or moral sense) to be (causatively, make) simple or (in a sinister way) delude
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
an opening (literally), i.e. door (gate) or entrance way

properly, hinder; generally, next, other, etc.
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to bend the knee; by implication, to sink, to prostrate
properly, hinder; generally, next, other, etc.

to root, i.e. strike into the soil, or (by implication) to pluck from it

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
properly, to toss, i.e. grapple; mostly figuratively, to wrangle, i.e. hold a controversy; (by implication) to defend

to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

15.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first

to debar (negatively or positively) from benefit or injury
pleasure; hence (abstractly) desire; concretely, a valuable thing; hence (by extension) a matter (as something in mind)
properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
a widow; also a desolate place
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

(only in plural collectively or emphatic form) youth, the state (juvenility) or the persons (young people)
to be (causatively make) large (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride)
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything
a mother (as the bond of the family); in a wide sense (both literally and figuratively (like father))
to guide; by implication, to transport (into exile, or as colonists)

19.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.
a garment (literally or figuratively); by implication (euphemistically) a wife
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

20.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
the loins (as the seat of vigor)
a fleece (as shorn); also mown grass
a ram (just old enough to butt)

an opening, i.e. door or gate

to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
a reed (as erect); by resemblance a rod (especially for measuring), shaft, tube, stem, the radius (of the arm), beam (of a steelyard)

a (sudden) alarm (properly, the object feared, by implication, the feeling)

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be able, literally (can, could) or morally (may, might)

to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky

properly, a refuge, i.e. (objective) security, or (subjective) assurance

abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength

to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn

to inquire; by implication, to request; by extension, to demand

properly, an adult (as of full length); by implication, a man (only in the plural)

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

something swinging, i.e. the valve of adoor

to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve

Adam the name of the first man, also of a place in Palestine

to be dumb; by implication, to be astonished, to stop; also to perish

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to shriek (from anguish or danger); by analogy, (as a herald) to announce or convene publicly

to puff, in various applications (literally, to inflate, blow hard, scatter, kindle, expire; figuratively, to disesteem)
